terminal said: libxine1-ffmpeg is already the newest version and 0 upgraded + newly installed 0 to remove and 0 upgraded

Error Loading Media No suitable demux plugin. This often means that the file format is not supported.
are you on Feisty?
yes
yes im on feisty
i'm *googling*. breathing on my neck won't help.
ook thanks for helping
try closing amarok, then    mv ~/.xine ~/.xine-backup       , then opening amarok again
i said      mv ~/.xine/ ~/.xine-backup     not     mv ~/.xine/ ~/.xine/-backup
now its working, thank you

get your ~/.xine directory out of the way. that's a directory that contains configuration files for Xine, the media engine that amarok uses to play stuff. google said that removing that directory solved that problem for other people.
is it out of the way now?

yes, although i've made you *move* it to somewhere else rather then *deleting* it, just in case. you can probably delete .xine-backup now if you want, though (but it'll just save you a couple of bytes on the disk)
thanks you are a real ubuntu god
